Recommended Treatment: Primary surgery (total hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy) completed; for FIGO IA, grade 2, no LVSI and no nodal involvement, NCCN recommends observation or vaginal brachytherapy as adjuvant options.
Description: This report documents a FIGO grade 2 endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the uterus with minimal (<10%) myometrial invasion, no lymphovascular invasion, no nodal or ovarian metastasis, and uncertain focal involvement of the fallopian tube. The tumor is confined to the uterus, consistent with Stage IA disease.
Patient Notes: Your pathology shows a low-stage uterine cancer that is confined to the lining and has not spread to lymph nodes or other organs. Because it is a low-risk, early-stage tumor, no further treatment beyond what you’ve already had may be needed, although a small internal radiation treatment (vaginal brachytherapy) is an option to reduce recurrence risk. We will discuss the best follow-up plan, which may simply be regular check-ups or include a brief radiation procedure.

verification.assessment: The extractor accurately captured the key diagnostic and staging elements and proposed treatment consistent with NCCN guidance. A few granular pathological details (exact mm invasion depth, lymph node sampling status, and tubal involvement uncertainty) were not pulled but do not materially change the core conclusions.
